intro: Rapona tiliifolia, commonly known as the yellow wood or tiliifolia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
